ai-iti18:1.1_0: This was said by the Buddha, the Perfected One: that is what I heard.
ai-iti18:2.1_0: “One thing, mendicants, arises in the world for the hurt and unhappiness of the people, for the harm, hurt, and suffering of gods and humans.
ai-iti18:2.4_0: When the Saṅgha is split, they argue, insult, block, and reject each other.
ai-iti18:2.5_0: This doesn’t inspire confidence in those without it, and it causes some with confidence to change their minds.”
ai-iti18:2.6_0: That is what the Buddha said.
ai-iti18:3.2_0: in a place of loss, in hell.
ai-iti18:3.3_0: Taking a stand against the teaching,
ai-iti18:3.5_0: After causing schism in a harmonious Saṅgha,
ai-iti18:3.6_0: they burn in hell for an eon.”
ai-iti18:4.1_0: This too was spoken by the Blessed One: that is what I heard.
